abstract: Egyptian authorities release student and photojournalist Esraa al-Taweel from prison after pictures of her plight spread through social media causing public outcry; Taweel, detained since June and still facing prosecution for alleged crimes, denies charges and says her false imprisonment is part of government’s clampdown on political dissenters.
lead_paragraph: Esraa al-Taweel, 23, who is also a photojournalist, was released after photos of her sobbing and hobbling on crutches went viral on social media.

headline.main: Egypt Releases Student in a Rare Bow to Public Pressure
headline.print_headline: Egypt Releases Student in Rare Bow to Pressure

snippet: Esraa al-Taweel, 23, who is also a photojournalist, was released after photos of her sobbing and hobbling on crutches went viral on social media.
